      • copyDirectory

        public static void copyDirectory(java.lang.Object requestor,
                                 VirtualFile fromDir,
                                 VirtualFile toDir,
                                 VirtualFileFilter filter)
                          throws java.io.IOException
        Copies all files matching the filter from fromDir to toDir. Symlinks end special files are ignored.
        Parameters:
        requestor - any object to control who called this method. Note that it is considered to be an external change if requestor is null. See VirtualFileEvent.getRequestor()
        fromDir - the directory to copy from
        toDir - the directory to copy to
        filter - VirtualFileFilter
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if files failed to be copied

      • copy

        public static VirtualFile copy(java.lang.Object requestor,
                               VirtualFile file,
                               VirtualFile toDir)
                        throws java.io.IOException
        Makes a copy of the file in the toDir folder and returns it. Handles both files and directories.
        Parameters:
        requestor - any object to control who called this method. Note that it is considered to be an external change if requestor is null. See VirtualFileEvent.getRequestor()
        file - file or directory to make a copy of
        toDir - directory to make a copy in
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if file failed to be copied

      • markDirtyAndRefresh

        public static void markDirtyAndRefresh(boolean async,
                                       boolean recursive,
                                       boolean reloadChildren,
                                       VirtualFile... files)
        Refreshes the VFS information of the given files from the local file system.

        This refresh is performed without help of the FileWatcher, which means that all given files will be refreshed even if the FileWatcher didn't report any changes in them. This method is slower, but more reliable, and should be preferred when it is essential to make sure all the given VirtualFiles are actually refreshed from disk.

        NB: when invoking synchronous refresh from a thread other than the event dispatch thread, the current thread must NOT be in a read action.

        See Also:
        VirtualFile.refresh(boolean, boolean)

      • markDirtyAndRefresh

        public static void markDirtyAndRefresh(boolean async,
                                       boolean recursive,
                                       boolean reloadChildren,
                                       java.io.File... files)
        See Also:
        markDirtyAndRefresh(boolean, boolean, boolean, VirtualFile...)
